user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of free_unmarked:
```c
static void
free_unmarked (struct MHD_PostProcessor *pp)
{
  if ( (NULL != pp->content_name) &&
       (0 == (pp->have & NE_content_name)) )
  {
    free (pp->content_name);
    pp->content_name = NULL;
  }
  if ( (NULL != pp->content_type) &&
       (0 == (pp->have & NE_content_type)) )
  {
    free (pp->content_type);
    pp->content_type = NULL;
  }
  if ( (NULL != pp->content_filename) &&
       (0 == (pp->have & NE_content_filename)) )
  {
    free (pp->content_filename);
    pp->content_filename = NULL;
  }
  if ( (NULL != pp->content_transfer_encoding) &&
       (0 == (pp->have & NE_content_transfer_encoding)) )
  {
    free (pp->content_transfer_encoding);
    pp->content_transfer_encoding = NULL;
  }
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if ( (NULL != pp->content_type) &&
       (0 == (pp->have & NE_content_type)) )
  {
    free (pp->content_type);
    pp->content_type = NULL;
  }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The if-body is executed when pp->content_type is non-NULL and the NE_content_type bit is not set in pp->have, so the code is reachable at runtime depending on program state. There is no compile-time constant expression here that makes the condition always false or true, so the block is not unreachable. (Only a hypothetical project-level situation — e.g. if analysis proved pp->content_type is always NULL at this point or the condition is reduced by preprocessing/constant folding to a constant false — would make the body unreachable, but no such evidence is present in the fragment.)
